alert.note: Alert for Kahoolawe in Maui (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 19 at 7:09AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 AM HST THIS MORNING FOR THE ISLAND OF MAUI IN MAUI COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...The island of Maui in Maui County. * WHEN...Until 1015 AM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in streams, poor drainage areas, and on roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 705 AM HST, radar indicated a stationary band of heavy rain over the east Maui mountains. Rain was falling at a rate of up to 1 inch per hour. Additonal rainfall is expected during the next few hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kipahulu, Kaupo, Hana, Nahiku, Hamoa and Haleakala National Park. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 1015 AM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding.
